comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Designed by Walter Liberty Vernon in 1910 (Federation Free Style), and completed in 1912.  From the (hideous) telegraph poles and lack of motor vehicles, the photo must be about 1912.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/] For AB :) - Thanks for posting the Will Daley poster photos so quickly. I'm looking forward to the next installment! [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/5208817698/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The hideous poles have multiplied! Australian Heritage Database - Place ID: 1996

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] C l e v e r !

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Funny Ha ha!  Laughing Out Loud.

[pretentious comment alert]
Looking at the image again, the photographer has used the telegraph poles, wires and wire shadows extremely artfully to frame the building and enhance the composition and perspective.  I bet it was John Degotardi Jnr.
[pretentious comment over]

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Taken at the same time, showing the other side: Darlinghurst Fire Station (no date) [SRNSW: 4481_a026_000991.jpg]

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Great mashup of a 'now and then' photo! The station looks just the same today.

Glad you are enjoying the Will Daley additions. More to come this week :)

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thank you, we'll add a c.1912 date to the photo.

AB

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: I saw this photo in a book recently. I'd never seen it before. It's a beauty to compare. Darlinghurst Road, top of William Street (1871), NSW Government Printing Office (probably by Charles Pickering) [SLNSW: SPF / 526, a089526]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Great find - what a shame they replaced 'Richmond House'. The "face" of the new building looks very unfriendly, frowning, and with no eyes, like a lot of Federation architecture. imho of course! [ St Johns Darlinghurst tower and spire added in 1875 - www.heritage.nsw.gov.au/07_subnav_01_2.cfm?itemid=5045590 ]
